Job Description:
The Role
Are you interested in serving the needs of millions of customers by building the best-in-class digital experience that helps them in financial planning, investing, and retirement solutions? Our teams build and contribute to Fidelity’s digital presence. Our chapter comprises teams that work on a wide range of applications and platforms like Fidelity.com, Fidelity Mobile and Investor Centers. We're looking for product-aware engineers who are passionate, inquisitive, and responsible individuals to help us on our mission to deliver the best omni-channel experience to our customers. Our teams build and contribute to Fidelity’s digital presence. As Machine Learning Engineer,
You’ll help build and maintain large scale ML Infrastructure and ML pipelines, contribute to building advanced analytics, dashboards, machine learning platform and tools to enable both prediction and optimization of model development, extend existing ML Platform and frameworks for scaling model training & deployment.
You’ll help build and scale ML operations using various cloud technologies and collaborating with Data Scientists to robustly scale up ML Models for large volumes in production for real time and batch inference to deliver personalized experiences to our customers.
You’ll effectively partner with Applied Data Scientists and lay software foundations upon which models can be built and explore new technology trends and leverage them to simplify our data and ML ecosystem.
You'll have the opportunity to contribute ideas to improve our products as well as develop your skills, learn new technologies and languages, and continue to learn.

The Expertise and Skills You Bring
Over 5 years of experience in architecture, design, development, and deployment of multi-tier internet facing web and mobile applications, APIs.
5 years of experience in developing ML infrastructure in the Cloud (AWS preferred) for DataOps, MLOps and DevOps including creation of automated CI/CD pipelines for ML models and deploying ML solutions to production.
3+ years of experience with building data pipelines in getting the data required to build, train and evaluate ML models, using tools like Apache Spark, Snowflake or other distributed data processing frameworks and CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins or equivalent), version control (Git), Artifactory.
Proven experience in Object Oriented Programming (Java, Python, Scala), functional scripting languages like JavaScript (NodeJs), Unix scripting or related programming languages and exposure to some of Python’s ML ecosystem(numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, sklearn, tensorflow, pytorch).
Solid knowledge of Cloud computing and infrastructure as code (IaS), hands-on experience with developing and deploying and managing applications in the Cloud.
You have working knowledge with Cloud Technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, AWS CLI, AWS CloudFormation, and AWS services including EC2, EMR, EKS, S3 and Big Data ML toolkits, such as SparkML and Amazon SageMaker.
Good understanding of Pip, Flask, Anaconda, or similar tool stack and ability to mentor junior developers on their usage.
Solid work experience in Agile methodologies such as Kanban and SCRUM.
Knowledge of applied data science methods, feature engineering and machine learning algorithms, and usage of word embeddings in Natural Language Processing.
Has Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a technology related field (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, etc.).

The Team
We believe that diversity in background and experience will foster an inclusive and engaging work environment for our employees. This ultimately enables us to deliver a better product for our customers.
Being technically competent is only telling half the story. We believe that delivering the best possible customer experience requires an artful blend of human ingenuity and technology. While we value smart technologists, we are fanatics about our culture that promotes autonomy and leadership at all levels.
People who are great cultural fits demonstrate curiosity to learn, are unafraid to break things, step up and take the lead, take ownership of their projects, and thrive by sharing knowledge and demonstrating our core pillars:
Imagine. Innovate. Inspire. Keep it cool: Nurture an inclusive organizational culture, foster positive energy & family spirit, recognize greatness, support each other & enjoy the journey.
Elevate the floor; Influence the horizontal: Commit to developing leadership at all levels. Help your peers & team get better by raising standards within and around while maintaining a strong focus on building future leaders.
Tightly aligned; loosely coupled: Establish or enhance partnerships across the organization to ensure alignment towards enterprise standards, tools and reusability while providing direction for teams to operate autonomously.
Level Up on Craftsmanship: Treat learning as a journey not a destination. Commit to learning and teaching as a part of your life.
Build the "Best" Tech together: Promote innovation driven by purpose and practicing autonomy with responsibility.
Company Culture
At Fidelity, you can find it all here. We reward results-oriented, hardworking individuals with a work environment that cultivates diversity, partnership and collaboration as well as encourages innovative ideas and fresh thinking. We recognize the value that employees’ individual differences can chip-in to the forward-thinking and strong future of our company.

Company Overview
Fidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.

Join Us
At Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a Best Place to Work in 2023. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.
At Fidelity, our goal is for most people to work flexibly in a way that balances both personal and business needs with time onsite and offsite through what we’re calling “Dynamic Working”. Most associates will have a hybrid schedule with a requirement to work onsite at a Fidelity work location for at least one week, 5 consecutive days, every four weeks. These requirements are subject to change.
We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.

Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.
Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations @fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.
At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.

Overview:
GDC IT Solutions is currently seeking a Data Science Manager in the Carlisle, PA area.
Position Overview:

Position Overview:
The Data Science Manager will report to the Director of Innovation and will be responsible for delivery of innovation acceleration and R&D service improvement through the leadership of the R&D Innovation data science team and digital lab. This will be a high visibility role operating under the general guidance of the EVP R&D and the Director of Innovation with frequent report outs to division and corporate executive staff.

Responsibilities:
Partner with the Innovation Director, R&D scientists, and management team members to identify opportunities for the application of data science to accelerate product and service innovation and improve R&D service to the business.
Leadership and talent development of innovation data science and digital lab team members.
Identification, justification, prioritization, execution, delivery, and communication of data projects that will accelerate innovation and R&D services.
Collaborate with R&D scientists, directors, and managers to identify projects and ensure proper use of data in innovation and support research resulting in the creation of business value. Oversight of data mining, exploration, analysis, and visualization activities.
Establish and continuously improve data science architecture, technology stack, governance, policies, standards, and processes.
Identify and develop partnerships with vendors and other stakeholders to enhance the R&D innovation data science mission.
Advocate and promote data informed innovation through presentations, mentoring and project communication. Contribute to and influence strategic direction and capital deployment for this purpose.
Collaborate with IT, sales, and operations leaders to establish best practices, architecture, policies, and strategy for enterprise data science.
Oversight of the digital innovation lab dedicated for the application of technology in building science and materials innovation.

Minimum Qualifications:
Minimum 2 years of experience in a business environment
Minimum bachelor's degree in data science, data analytics, or related field with -or- Master’s degree or Ph.D. in a quantitative field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or engineering
Minimum 2 years of experience with leadership and talent development with direct reports
Demonstrated team leadership and talent development capabilities.
Demonstrated strong project management capabilities (certifications appreciated).
Strong business acumen and ability to illustrate and communicate business value for data projects. Experience with development of quantitative and qualitative business cases.
Working knowledge of technologies, software, and hardware commonly utilized in a data science environment:
Knowledge of data science languages and toolkits (such as R, Python, Java, NumPy, and MatLab)
Experience with big data analytics technologies (such as Spark and Hadoop)
Experience with data visualization tools (such as D3.js and Tableau)
Expertise in data mining, collection, and machine learning
Working knowledge of statistical models and business intelligence
Ability to store and process unstructured data with databases and machine learning models
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate technical details in business language and relate technical concepts to a business impact.
Skilled in organizing and motivating team members to produce high-quality, on-time results.
Demonstrated ability to develop and communicate strategy, vision, and direction and to embrace and facilitate change.
Advanced root cause problem-solving skills and the ability to anticipate and coordinate tactical plans impacting the growth of needs for data services.
A demonstrated ability to leverage existing resources to maximize technology investments.

What We Do:
Working for GDC means you will be at the forefront of the technological world. We are a full-service staffing and Information Technology service company striving to make a difference in our communities by finding, developing, and deploying solutions.
Why Work for GDC?
Cutting Edge Technology and Innovation

job title: Sr. Manager of Manufacturing Analytics & Data Science
job description:
At Niagara, we’re looking for Team Members who want to be part of achieving our mission to provide our customers the highest quality most affordable bottled water.
Consider applying here, if you want to:
Work in an entrepreneurial and dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact.
Develop lasting relationships with great people.
Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career.
We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages for our Team Members.
Sr. Manager of Manufacturing Analytics & Data Science
This position is 100% remote.
Our Sr. Manager of Manufacturing Analytics & Data Science team is responsible for delivering data insights and solutions, as an essential part of driving business growth and supporting data-driven decision making. This team focuses on data from Niagara’s broad manufacturing operations, to develop real-time and strategic analytics models to augment our business strategies. The Manufacturing Analytics team, Data Solutions team (data engineering), Continuous Improvement, and Training teams work together as one ‘Finance Analytics – Manufacturing’ team. These collective groups’ support Niagara’s Manufacturing and Finance teams (plant & corporate).
The Sr. Manager of Analytics & Data Science is an organizational leader who transforms data into valuable business intelligence and insights, utilizing effective strategies and implementing analytics solutions. Likewise, this leader is responsible for developing and guiding an engaged team of data analysts and data scientists, who own data consumption to actionable insights. This leader collaboratively works with business leaders/stakeholders in IT, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Finance, Engineering, and adjacent analytics groups to advance initiatives or projects. Said leader is responsible for creating and implementing manufacturing’s analytic and data science strategic roadmap in alignment with our company strategy; linking data-related activities to business results. Furthermore, this leader understands how technology tools, business intelligence, analytics and data science activities of the team, can be utilized as a source of competitive advantage.
Essential Functions
Leads a team of data analysts and data scientists within the Manufacturing/Finance Analytics team.
Drive business analytics and capabilities; answering key business questions using innovative analytic and data science techniques; solving long term strategic outcomes.
Designs, develops and implements a broad array of business analytics that solve complex problems. Identifies new opportunities to further leverage analytics, data and analytical tools.
Monitor trends in key business KPIs, providing valuable insights to relevant departments for overall business performance improvement.
Serves as a key point of contact for all data analytics and insights initiatives within Manufacturing and Finance, and supports initiatives undertaken by adjacent analytics and continuous improvement teams.
Coordinates with Manufacturing and Finance leadership; developing analytics/data science technology and roadmaps for Manufacturing/Finance.
Ensure necessary data architecture and software tools are available; enabling actionable, insightful and impactful reporting, statistical analyses, and the like.
Understands and supports the development of reporting dashboards in a variety of platforms such as Tableau, Power BI and OACS.
Ensures best practice adoption within stated areas of responsibility, applying appropriate levels of technical capability, standardization and subject matter expertise.
Build data science competency and talent needs through role definition, and development of a team of data scientists.
Drive education and evangelization of data sciences throughout the business.
Please note this job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive list of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without prior notice.
Competencies
Experience in leading teams who have expertise in data mining algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, decision trees, neural nets, support vector machines, genetic algorithms, anomaly detection, recommender systems, and natural language processing
Expert command of machine learning, statistical modeling, state-of-the-art tools, and engineering best practices
Experience with scripting languages (R, Python, SQL, Java, etc.)
Experience in various enterprise resource solution tools such as Oracle ERP, Oracle EBS, and Oracle OBIEE/OACS.
Proven strong aptitude in data visualization platforms such as Tableau, PowerBI, Grafana.
Proven strong aptitude in data science platforms such as MS Azure
Experienced in Manufacturing Execution Systems
Self-development – A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Entrepreneurial – Initiative and resourcefulness with limited guidance.
Leadership – Engaging, passionate, courageous leader who inspires and influences team members of all levels with humility and respect; Influences actions and opinions of others
People Development – Fosters a quality focus in others; Builds upon areas of strength; Designs and executes plan to improve areas of weakness
Project Management – Detail oriented with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks and projects and complete assignments quickly and accurately.
Problem Solving – Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully
Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively; Demonstrates ability to communicate well with other team members and with non-technical end users; demonstrates presentation skills.
Team Work - Balances team and individual responsibilities; contributes to building a positive team spirit; able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives.
Written Communication - Writes clearly and informatively; presents numerical data effectively
Qualifications
Minimum Qualifications:
6 Years– Experience in Field or similar
4 Years – Experience in Position
4 Years – Experience managing people/projects
*experience may include a combination of work experience and education*
*
Preferred Qualifications:
10+ Years – Experience in Field or similar
6 Years – Experience working in Position
6 Years – Experience managing people/projects
experience may include a combination of work experience and education
Competencies*
Proficiency in, but not limited to:
*
Microsoft Office Applications – Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, Visio, etc.
Oracle Business Systems
Manufacturing Execution Systems
Efficiency Improvement Analysis Applications
New System Implementation & Administration
Experience with modeling and analysis including machine learning, statistical analysis, operations research and management science and data mining.
Experience with scripting languages - R, Python, SQL, etc.
Able to translate data into recommendable actions to senior staff
Able to develop a thorough understanding of existing processes to conceptualize process improvements and deliver tangible results
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Project Management
Self-Motivated with a proven record of taking the initiative
Able to work with minimal supervision
Detail-Oriented with Excellent Oral and Written Communication Skills
Able to execute tasks in a very dynamic and ever-changing environment
Exercise sound judgment and ability to work effectively with a diverse workforce
This position embodies the values of Niagara’s LIFE competency model, focusing on the following key drivers of success:*
*
Lead Like an Owner
Manages a safe working environment, accurately documents safety related training, and effectively communicates safety incidents
Provides strategic input and oversight to departmental projects
Makes data driven decisions and develops sustainable solutions
Skilled in reducing costs and managing timelines while prioritizing long run impact over short term wins
Makes decisions by putting overall company success first before department/individual success
Leads/facilitates discussions to get positive outcomes for the customer
Makes strategic decisions which prioritize the needs of the customer over departmental/individual goals
InnovACT
Continuously evaluates existing programs and processes, and develops new initiatives to increase efficiency and reduce waste
Creates, monitors, and responds to departmental performance metrics to drive continuous improvement
Communicates a clear vision, organizes resources effectively, and adjusts the strategy as needed when managing change
Find a Way
Demonstrates ability to think analytically and synthesize complex information
Effectively delegates technical tasks to subordinates
Works effectively with departments, vendors, and customers to achieve organizational success
Identifies opportunities for collaboration in strategic ways
Empowered to be Great
Makes hiring decisions primarily based on culture fit and attitude, and secondarily based on technical expertise
Engages in long term talent planning
Provides opportunities for the development of all direct reports
Understands, identifies, and addresses conflict within own team and between teams
Proven record of task and project execution from conception to completion
Education*
*
Minimum Required:
Bachelor's Degree (Machine learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar)
Master's Degree (Machine learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar)
Preferred:
Master's Degree (Machine learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or similar)

job title: Senior Artificial Intelligence Engineer - Pioneering the Future of FinTech
job description:
Senior Artificial Intelligence Engineer - Pioneering the Future of FinTech
Are you passionate about the financial industry and the stock market? Do you want to be part of a small yet established team, where your contributions can have a significant impact?
We're a U.S.-based tech company pushing the boundaries of the tech industry. Our goal? To develop the most advanced financial superintelligence for the marketplace that can assimilate the entire world's recorded financial data and predict market trends. Our vision is ambitious, and we need a seasoned AI professional to help make it a reality.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with a diverse team of software engineers, data scientists, and machine learning (ML) experts to create cutting-edge AI models.
Contribute to the strategic direction of our AI development by working closely with our lead engineers to establish coding standards and best practices.
Conduct in-depth statistical analysis on large-scale financial data sets to uncover patterns, derive insights, and develop predictive algorithmic models.
Oversee project infrastructure development and drive the evolution of our AI models and projects.
Run diagnostic tests, rectify defects, and provide technical support to ensure the smooth running of our AI infrastructure.
Required Languages and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or several years of experience in computer science, data science, software development, or another related field.
Strong command of programming languages commonly used in AI, such as Python, Java, C++, and R.
In-depth knowledge of statistical and algorithmic models and fundamental mathematical concepts like linear algebra and probability.
Proven track record of working with large, dynamic data sets and writing efficient code capable of processing these large data streams swiftly.
Proficiency with deep learning and machine learning algorithms and familiar with popular AI/ML frameworks.
Excellent communication skills, capable of leading and inspiring a team of talented professionals.
What We Offer:
An opportunity to be a part of a stable, fast-growing tech company that's pushing the boundaries of the tech industry.
A chance to have a significant impact in a small but established team.

Job Overview:
The Senior Financial Data Analyst is a highly visible role that provides critical insights into financial results. This role will work alongside other members of the finance organization to help management understand and analyze financial results. This position will work with large amounts of data requiring advanced analytical capabilities and ability to work with data and financial analysis tools to provide meaningful insight. The role applies a mix of accounting and analytical, functional, and technical skills to develop and implement innovative solutions that promote continuous process improvement. The role also provides support to strategic projects and other finance transformation initiatives.
*
Job Responsibilities:*
Support monthly in-depth analytics of financial results.

Accounts Receivable Executive Package for Monthly AR Operations Review

Ability to work in a collaborative cross functional environment

Energetic, hard-working, self-starter
Capacity to analyze complex problems and make decisions in a timely manner

Job Summary
As a Statistical Project Leader, you will provide statistical leadership and guidance for clinical studies in one or more indications and will be accountable for methodological and statistical aspects of clinical development or medical affairs plans and subsequent deliverables. Utilizing strong study management, interpersonal and communication skills, you will be expected to ensure productive collaborations with other functions, as well as with other statistical project leaders and in communicating with senior leadership. You will promote teamwork, quality, operational efficiency, and innovation, as also represent Biostatistics (or provide leadership) in scientific or technology working groups or cross functional initiatives.
Major Duties and Responsibilities
With minimal direction from the group head, direct statistical support and provide scientific leadership for one moderate project, one or several indications or a highly complex large study in Neurology late phase.
Be accountable for statistical aspects of late clinical development, studies and submissions activities (when applicable), including relevance to external stakeholders (e.g. regulatory authorities, medical journals) and scientific validity, according to internal standards and regulatory guidelines, and in compliance with SOPs.
Plan and track project activities, timelines, and resource use. Seek to optimize resource utilization through efficient and well-managed resource allocation and across projects or areas.
Provide justifications for planned resource needs, allowing for the capacity to respond to unscheduled increase in project workload as needed. Effectively utilize external groups, e.g. CROs or data monitoring committees (DMCs), as applicable.
Represent Statistics in regulatory meetings.
Act as statistical consultant within company, and provide technical guidance and mentoring to people working on the projects.
Contribute to process optimization and provide input to statistical standards.
Required Education/Experience
PhD/MS in statistics or related discipline with at least 6 years of pharmaceutical experience.
Broad experience in clinical development or post-marketing activities such as submissions, interactions with regulatory agencies or other external stakeholders.
Broad knowledge and good understanding of advanced statistical concepts and techniques.
Experience in Neurology therapeutic areas preferred.

What You Will Do:
Guidehouse is looking for a Data Analyst/Scientist to increase the usability of a security sector client’s data assets and serve as a strategic advisor to the client to advance data analysis, governance, and management. He/she will possess a thorough understanding of business and data strategy; have experience mentoring and managing junior resources; be able to oversee the collection, storage, management, quality, and protection of data; and, will have an ability to communicate the status, value, and importance of data analytics and management to project team members and senior clients.

Developing sustainable and reproducible data management and governance processes
Promoting the use of data insights and analytics to enrich business decision-making and key business initiatives, including developing and refining Tableau dashboards and other visualizations for key client stakeholders
Guiding data infrastructure development, deployment, and maintenance to accelerate data informed decision making
Reviewing presentations, graphs and other visualizations, and tables to ensure accuracy and quality
Maintaining data management plans and instructions for operating complex business systems
Ensuring data and information security by integrating and upholding digital security standards
Understanding the client’s organization and culture to improve data governance and management, analytics maturity, and advanced analytics capabilities
Serving as a strategic thought partner to guide business decisions and provide input to data strategies and metrics
Piloting ways to leverage emerging and disruptive capabilities including machine learning, natural language processing, robotics/automation, etc.

FIVE (5) years of relevant experience
Bachelor's degree

1+ years of project, product, or program management
Proficiency in R/Python or other scripting languages

Ability to communicate complex technical concepts and insights to senior business leaders and partners in a relevant and actionable manner in writing and verbally
Teamwork and collaboration mindset, interpersonal and relationship-building skills, and ability to lead by influence and example

As a data engineer, you know that organizing big data can yield pivotal insights when it’s gathered from disparate sources. We need a big data experienced professional like you to help our clients find answers in their data to impact important missions from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence.
As a lead big data engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll use your expertise to lead data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. You’ll oversee the development and deployment of pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful. Here, you’ll guide and mentor a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. You’ll use your expertise in analytical exploration and data examination while you oversee the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients. Work with us to use big data for good.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
8+ years of experience with data engineering, data architecture, machine learning engineering, or software engineering
8+ years of experience designing, developing, operationalizing, and maintaining complex data applications at enterprise scale
5+ years of experience with a large program management project or managing technical teams
Experience creating software for retrieving, parsing, and processing structured and unstructured data
Experience with Agile project management methodologies
Experience building scalable ETL/ELT workflows for reporting and analytics
Experience creating solutions within a collaborative, cross-functional team environment
Ability to develop scripts and programs for converting various types of data into usable formats and support project team to scale, monitor, and operate data platforms
Secret clereance
Bachelor’s degree
Nice If You Have:
Experience with client and industry relationships across the US Navy
Experience with Python, SQL, Scala, or Java
Experience with UNIX and Linux, including basic commands and Shell scripting
Experience with a public cloud, including AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud
Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka
Experience working on real-time data and streaming applications
Experience with NoSQL implementation, including MongoDB or Cassandra
Experience with data warehousing using AWS Redshift, MySQL, or Snowflake
Ability to manage client and team relationships
Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification

job title: AI and ML Research and Development Technologist, Senior
job description:
The Opportunity:
As an experienced engineer, you know that machine learning (ML) is critical to understanding and processing massive datasets. Your ability to conduct statistical analyses on business processes using ML techniques makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused solution. We need your technical knowledge and desire to problem-solve to support clients.
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced artificial intelligence (AI) and ML research and development (R&D) Lead Technologist with a background in integrating AI and ML into the framework of Intelligent Autonomous Systems (IAS). The ideal candidate will help build and lead an R&D team in developing and integrating cutting-edge AI and ML technologies into autonomous systems. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the design and development of advanced algorithms and software solutions that enable the effective operation of trusted autonomous systems. You will conduct experiments to explore new AI and ML technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, system engineers, and product managers to ensure the successful integration of these technologies into the IAS development pipeline. You will also help develop Test, Evaluation, Verification, and Validation (TEV&V) procedures and techniques for IAS.
Work with us to solve real-world challenges and define ML strategy for our key DoD clients.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
Experience in AI or ML research and development, with a focus on autonomous systems
Experience with ML, computer vision, and deep learning algorithms
Experience with programming languages, including Python, C++, or Java
Ability to develop innovative ML models and algorithms and solutions to improve the performance of IAS
Ability to present research findings and recommendations to clients and executive leadership
Ability to build collaboration partnerships with industry and academic institutions
Ability to identify opportunities for innovation by keeping up with the latest developments in AI and ML technologies and autonomous systems technologies
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelor's degree in CS or EE
Nice If You Have:
Experience with DevOps tooling, pipelines, and building containerized applications to run in a Kubernetes environment
Experience with CI/CD principles, methodologies, and tools, including GitLab CI/CD and Jenkins
Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka
Experience leading a team of AI and ML engineers, researchers, and data scientists to develop and deploy advanced AI and ML technologies in autonomous systems
Possession of strong communication and leadership skills
Possession of strong R&D proposal writing and organization skills
Secret clearance
Master's degree in CS or EE

job description:
About Blue Cross
Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Minnesota is one of the most recognized and trusted health care brands in the world with 2.5 million members. We’re committed to reinventing health care to improve health for our members and the community. We hope you'll join us.
How is this Role Important to Our Work?
This position works across the Enterprise to identify areas of opportunities to build process efficiencies, innovate and contribute using sophisticated analytics and data science. The position will manage sophisticated data and information to provide meaningful results, which influence strategic decision-making at Blue Cross. Responsibilities include understand sophisticated complex business requirements, data management and stewardship for sophisticated-data sources, data analysis and advanced analytical techniques, and building predictive models to bring value for the organization.
A Day in the Life:
Take lead on data science projects to craft and implement models and experiments from end to end, including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation.
Lead-by-example junior data scientists around mature data science practices e.g., readable code, detailed documentation, comprehensive experimentation.
Work with business partners to convert ambiguous business problems in clear data science/ML specifications. Use contextual business sense to convert model predictions/results into impactful insights and provide concrete mentorship on risks and limitations.
Drive conversations with product managers, data engineers, and subject matter experts to ship new models, algorithms and improvements continuously and collaboratively into production.
Use combination of machine learning knowledge and contextual eye for business to convert results into impactful insights and provide concrete mentorship on risks and limitations of model.
Write narrative documents for model specification and performance analysis to communicate findings and recommendations to teammates, collaborators and executive leadership.
Nice to Have:
Bachelor's degree.
Experience with health care data
Experience with SAS, SQL, R, Python
Experience with public health program evaluation
Experience with AWS tools
Experience with version control (for example Git Version Control system)
Role Designation:
Teleworker
Role designation definition: Teleworking is working full time remote. Hybrid is a combination of working onsite and remotely. Onsite is full-time onsite.
Make a difference
Blue Cross is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer that values diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any other legally protected characteristic.
Reasonable Accommodation for Job Seekers with a Disability: If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to talent.acquisition@bluecrossmn.com.
All roles require a high school diploma (or equivalency) and legal authorization to work in the U.S.
Blue Cross® and Blue Shield® of Minnesota and Blue Plus® are nonprofit independent licensees of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association.

Job Brief
$2,500 sign-on bonus and relocation expenses are negotiable.
The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is looking for a Sr. Data Architect to support our government customer located in Albuquerque, NM.
The role of the Sr Data Architect is to collaborate with data scientists, researchers, users, model and sim engineers, user experience designers, software engineers, digitizers, cataloguers, and system administrators to design a system to collect, manage, and convert raw data from the DTRIAC archive into usable information for U.S. deterrent missions.
The Sr. Data Architect will answer:
What variables should be stored?
What data quality issues might arise?
What database options are best for near term and long term?
What is the design of the data management system?
What system design will meet customer requirements?
Alaka'ina maintains a repository of over 20,000 films, 2,000,000 photographs, and 60,000,000 pages of documents dating back to The Manhattan Project. Alaka'ina will make repository digitally accessible to DTRA deterrent mission researchers in a way that provides knowledge and meaning using Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and data science to return relevant search results to user queries
DESCRIPTION OF RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design tools and methodologies to process the digital collection in a production mode.
Develop and implement methods for, and configurations of, the Data Lake to support navigation, search, insertion, or extraction of information or files by the government or other performers without requiring proprietary software, tools, or data other than widely available commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) tools, and software that can be authorized for use on government IT systems.
Develop, maintain, and improve capabilities, such as scripting, to efficiently perform maintenance, synchronization, and production processing of data in the Data Lake on Windows- and Linux-based IT systems, including HPCMP clusters.
Implement, configure, perform functional testing, and operate the data and applications of the Advanced Search and Discovery (ASD) environment as a hosted capability on government IT systems.
Leverage the collection, capabilities, and team to perform targeted analyses and studies and to provide dedicated support to missions and end users.
Create documentation or training materials for Project Products.
Support integration or hosting of capabilities or products on government IT systems.
Hold and participate in Gate Reviews.
Other duties as assigned.
REQUIRED DEGREE/EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION:
Current Security+ Certification or equivalent required.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
5+ years relevant experience.
Experience with DevSecOps
Experience building and working with data pipelines and large data sets.
Experience with schema design and data modeling.
Deep understanding of algorithms and efficient data structures.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience using revision control software such as git
Experience using CI/CD tools such as GitHub
Experience with containerization using Docker, Podman, Apptainer/Singularity
Experience with databases, especially NoSQL and ElasticSearch
Experience with ML/DL particularly NLP
Experience with OCR
Experience with computer vision/image processing
Proficiency in Python
REQUIRED CITIZENSHIP AND CLEARANCE:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Active Secret or DOE Q Clearance required.

The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is a fast-growing government service provider. Employees enjoy competitive salaries; a 401K plan with company match; medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage; tuition reimbursement; paid time off; and 11 paid holidays.
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are proud to state that we do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you are a person with a disability and you need an accommodation during the application process, please click here to request accommodation. We E-Verify all employees.
The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is comprised of industry-recognized government service firms designated as Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO)-owned and 8(a) certified businesses. The Family of Companies (FOCs) includes Ke`aki Technologies, Laulima Government Solutions, Kūpono Government Services, and Kapili Services, Po`okela Solutions, Kīkaha Solutions, LLC, and Pololei Solutions, LLC. Alaka`ina Foundation activities principally benefit the youth of Hawaii through charitable efforts which includes providing innovative educational programs that combine leadership, science & technology, and environmental stewardship.
For additional information, please visit www.alakainafoundation.com.

At ON1, your skills solve real-world problems in amazing new ways. We believe in the power and ownership of individual engineers, so we clear the decks so they can be productive. There are no politics, no micro-managing, and a minimal amount of process.

ON1 is a 17-year-old, privately-owned company headquartered in Portland, OR. We've provided award-winning software to millions of photographers worldwide. We put the photographer first, and this means our customers have complete control over every aspect of their photography. Our mission is to deliver the tools photographers need to organize, edit and share their photos.
The Role
ON1 Software is seeking an engineer with a passion for high-performance image processing with practical experience in machine learning. We're a small but mighty engineering team focused on solving problems that are thought of as unsolvable. Applicants will work closely with experienced photographers and QA through all stages of the engineering process.

Bachelors degree in computer science or similar field
Deep knowledge of image processing
Real-world experience implementing solutions based on academic papers
Practical skills in machine learning including pytorch and strong mathematics, probability, and statistics skills
Can develop strategies to solve small training data problems including creating synthetic training data
Experience with OpenGL, Metal, DirectX, Vulkan or other shader development
Experience building complex desktop apps that have been successfully delivered to customers
Thorough knowledge of C++
Familiar with Windows and macOS development.
Solid practices in object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, and problem-solving
Excellent debugging skills
Applicant should be self-motivated, well-organized, and able to work in an independent manner
Good habits and self-testing of code are critical

Experience in mobile application development with Android or iOS
Experience with computer vision
Experience using Qt in a cross-platform environment

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Performs a combination of duties in accordance with departmental guidelines:
Builds out AI/ML and PAAS capabilities in conjunction with our analytics partners to drive business value.
Productionizes and operationalizes predictive models leveraging machine learning and advanced data analysis techniques.
Designs and builds reusable platforms and pipelines to scale AI/ML solutions in a cloud environment.

Job Description:
We are seeking a talented and experienced leader to head our Machine Learning team, driving the development of AI-driven solutions that will shape the future of the company. As Supervisor of the Machine Learning Team, you will drive the creation and execution of our roadmap, lead a team of associates and be responsible for managing our ML platform. With a strong background in Machine Learning and practical experience in building and implementing various large-scale models to solve business problems, you will help to bring insights and identify additional opportunities from Data & Machine Learning to market.
This position requires in-office attendance in one of four locations in the United States, three days per week. Remote candidates are not being considered.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsible to:
Conduct statistical modeling and experiment design; test and validate predictive models.
Collect and analyze statistics and information from multiple sources to spot trends and to gain maximum insight
Find and recommend new uses for existing data sources; design, modify and build new data processes; build large, complex data sets.
Work with internal departments and partners to gather requirements and create chatbot solutions that meet business needs.
Communicate complex concepts and the results of models and analyses to both technical and non-technical audiences, influencing partners and customers with your insights and expertise.
Coordinate and manage the work effort of assigned staff using experience and management reporting tools to align work activities with organization priorities and objectives.
Make decisions regarding personnel action (hiring, termination, promotions, etc.) of both internal and temporary staff.
Coordinate the technical evaluation of proposals, projects and changes to the existing environment to assure stability and alignment with current architectures.
Confer with and advise subordinates on administrative policies and procedures, technical problems, priorities and methods.
Consult and coordinate work activities that involve multiple departments to align resources to priorities and schedules.
Prepare activity and progress reports.
Develop career-path opportunities for staff through project assignments, training and encouragement to pursue additional education.
Control revenues and expenses within an operating unit and meet budget goals and objectives.
Maintain relationships with vendors needed to support the department's activities.
EXPERIENCE:
Demonstrated experience in designing and deploying advanced models such as forecasting, Natural Language Processing, etc.
Experience with data modeling and data exploration tools, including expertise in the use of scientific computing and data management packages.
Experience with developing and deploying chatbots.
A demonstrated ability to provide vision and strategic direction at an institutional or enterprise level.
Coding proficiency, preferably in Python.
Excellent quantitative critical thinking skills.
Prior experience managing teams that build machine learning models.
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field, or directly relevant experience may be considered in lieu of a degree.
Communication and Interpersonal skills:
Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.
Ability to prioritize and handle multiple projects and prioritize effectively.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
At a minimum, the ability to work from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Friday.
Consistent attendance is required, which may include attendance at after-hour Company events.
Ability to accept supervision.
Ability to foster, develop and maintain professional and collaborative working relationships. Must be able to get along with others, i.e., peers, supervisors, outside customers, and vendors.
Ability to interact effectively and professionally with all levels of management, employees and customers by email, phone, video conferences and in person.
Must be a personable, positive, and professional representative of the company.
Ability to work overtime as requested and approved by supervisor.
Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Outlook.
PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS:
Overnight business travel by air and/or automobile, may be required.
The ability to maintain confidences and confidential information may be required.
The ability to perform under pressure and to be flexible with disruptions and deadlines is required.
Sedentary work: The majority of activity in this position involves sedentary work including sitting, standing, walking and the occasional need to lift or move objects.

Job Brief
$2,500 sign-on bonus and relocation expenses are negotiable.
The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is looking for a Sr. Data Architect to support our government customer located in Albuquerque, NM.
The role of the Sr Data Architect is to collaborate with data scientists, researchers, users, model and sim engineers, user experience designers, software engineers, digitizers, cataloguers, and system administrators to design a system to collect, manage, and convert raw data from the DTRIAC archive into usable information for U.S. deterrent missions.
The Sr. Data Architect will answer:
What variables should be stored?
What data quality issues might arise?
What database options are best for near term and long term?
What is the design of the data management system?
What system design will meet customer requirements?
Alaka'ina maintains a repository of over 20,000 films, 2,000,000 photographs, and 60,000,000 pages of documents dating back to The Manhattan Project. Alaka'ina will make repository digitally accessible to DTRA deterrent mission researchers in a way that provides knowledge and meaning using Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and data science to return relevant search results to user queries
DESCRIPTION OF RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design tools and methodologies to process the digital collection in a production mode.
Develop and implement methods for, and configurations of, the Data Lake to support navigation, search, insertion, or extraction of information or files by the government or other performers without requiring proprietary software, tools, or data other than widely available commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) tools, and software that can be authorized for use on government IT systems.
Develop, maintain, and improve capabilities, such as scripting, to efficiently perform maintenance, synchronization, and production processing of data in the Data Lake on Windows- and Linux-based IT systems, including HPCMP clusters.
Implement, configure, perform functional testing, and operate the data and applications of the Advanced Search and Discovery (ASD) environment as a hosted capability on government IT systems.
Leverage the collection, capabilities, and team to perform targeted analyses and studies and to provide dedicated support to missions and end users.
Create documentation or training materials for Project Products.
Support integration or hosting of capabilities or products on government IT systems.
Hold and participate in Gate Reviews.
Other duties as assigned.
REQUIRED DEGREE/EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION:
Current Security+ Certification or equivalent required.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
5+ years relevant experience.
Experience with DevSecOps
Experience building and working with data pipelines and large data sets.
Experience with schema design and data modeling.
Deep understanding of algorithms and efficient data structures.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience using revision control software such as git
Experience using CI/CD tools such as GitHub
Experience with containerization using Docker, Podman, Apptainer/Singularity
Experience with databases, especially NoSQL and ElasticSearch
Experience with ML/DL particularly NLP
Experience with OCR
Experience with computer vision/image processing
Proficiency in Python
REQUIRED CITIZENSHIP AND CLEARANCE:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Active Secret or DOE Q Clearance required.

The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is a fast-growing government service provider. Employees enjoy competitive salaries; a 401K plan with company match; medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage; tuition reimbursement; paid time off; and 11 paid holidays.
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are proud to state that we do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you are a person with a disability and you need an accommodation during the application process, please click here to request accommodation. We E-Verify all employees.
The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is comprised of industry-recognized government service firms designated as Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO)-owned and 8(a) certified businesses. The Family of Companies (FOCs) includes Ke`aki Technologies, Laulima Government Solutions, Kūpono Government Services, and Kapili Services, Po`okela Solutions, Kīkaha Solutions, LLC, and Pololei Solutions, LLC. Alaka`ina Foundation activities principally benefit the youth of Hawaii through charitable efforts which includes providing innovative educational programs that combine leadership, science & technology, and environmental stewardship.
For additional information, please visit www.alakainafoundation.com.

job title: AI and ML Research and Development Technologist, Senior
job description:
The Opportunity:
As an experienced engineer, you know that machine learning (ML) is critical to understanding and processing massive datasets. Your ability to conduct statistical analyses on business processes using ML techniques makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused solution. We need your technical knowledge and desire to problem-solve to support clients.
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced artificial intelligence (AI) and ML research and development (R&D) Lead Technologist with a background in integrating AI and ML into the framework of Intelligent Autonomous Systems (IAS). The ideal candidate will help build and lead an R&D team in developing and integrating cutting-edge AI and ML technologies into autonomous systems. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the design and development of advanced algorithms and software solutions that enable the effective operation of trusted autonomous systems. You will conduct experiments to explore new AI and ML technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, system engineers, and product managers to ensure the successful integration of these technologies into the IAS development pipeline. You will also help develop Test, Evaluation, Verification, and Validation (TEV&V) procedures and techniques for IAS.
Work with us to solve real-world challenges and define ML strategy for our key DoD clients.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
Experience in AI or ML research and development, with a focus on autonomous systems
Experience with ML, computer vision, and deep learning algorithms
Experience with programming languages, including Python, C++, or Java
Ability to develop innovative ML models and algorithms and solutions to improve the performance of IAS
Ability to present research findings and recommendations to clients and executive leadership
Ability to build collaboration partnerships with industry and academic institutions
Ability to identify opportunities for innovation by keeping up with the latest developments in AI and ML technologies and autonomous systems technologies
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelor's degree in CS or EE
Nice If You Have:
Experience with DevOps tooling, pipelines, and building containerized applications to run in a Kubernetes environment
Experience with CI/CD principles, methodologies, and tools, including GitLab CI/CD and Jenkins
Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka
Experience leading a team of AI and ML engineers, researchers, and data scientists to develop and deploy advanced AI and ML technologies in autonomous systems
Possession of strong communication and leadership skills
Possession of strong R&D proposal writing and organization skills
Secret clearance
Master's degree in CS or EE
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Create Your Career:
Grow With Us
Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.
A Place Where You Belong
Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.
Support Your Well-Being
Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.
Your Candidate Journey
At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $93,300.00 to $212,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.
EEO Commitment
We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

job title: Senior Artificial Intelligence Engineer - Pioneering the Future of FinTech
job description:
Senior Artificial Intelligence Engineer - Pioneering the Future of FinTech
Are you passionate about the financial industry and the stock market? Do you want to be part of a small yet established team, where your contributions can have a significant impact?
We're a U.S.-based tech company pushing the boundaries of the tech industry. Our goal? To develop the most advanced financial superintelligence for the marketplace that can assimilate the entire world's recorded financial data and predict market trends. Our vision is ambitious, and we need a seasoned AI professional to help make it a reality.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with a diverse team of software engineers, data scientists, and machine learning (ML) experts to create cutting-edge AI models.
Contribute to the strategic direction of our AI development by working closely with our lead engineers to establish coding standards and best practices.
Conduct in-depth statistical analysis on large-scale financial data sets to uncover patterns, derive insights, and develop predictive algorithmic models.
Oversee project infrastructure development and drive the evolution of our AI models and projects.
Run diagnostic tests, rectify defects, and provide technical support to ensure the smooth running of our AI infrastructure.
Required Languages and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree or several years of experience in computer science, data science, software development, or another related field.
Strong command of programming languages commonly used in AI, such as Python, Java, C++, and R.
In-depth knowledge of statistical and algorithmic models and fundamental mathematical concepts like linear algebra and probability.
Proven track record of working with large, dynamic data sets and writing efficient code capable of processing these large data streams swiftly.
Proficiency with deep learning and machine learning algorithms and familiar with popular AI/ML frameworks.
Excellent communication skills, capable of leading and inspiring a team of talented professionals.
What We Offer:
An opportunity to be a part of a stable, fast-growing tech company that's pushing the boundaries of the tech industry.
A chance to have a significant impact in a small but established team.
Generous stock options, giving you a stake in our shared success.
An environment that nurtures its employees, supports their growth, and encourages innovation.
If you're a seasoned AI professional eager to shape the future of finance and make a significant impact on our groundbreaking project, apply now and help us build the world's most advanced financial superintelligence!
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $300,000.00 - $500,000.00 per year
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Ability to commute/relocate:
New York, NY: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Application Question(s):
How many years experience in computer science, data science, software development, or another related field? Explain
Experience:
Python: 6 years (Required)
Java: 6 years (Required)
C++: 6 years (Required)
R: 6 years (Required)
AI: 6 years (Required)
Willingness to travel:
50% (Required)
Work Location: Remote

When you’re the best, we’re the best. We instill an environment where employees feel engaged, satisfied and able to contribute their unique skills and talents while living and working as their authentic selves. We provide extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, building both employee competence and organizational capability to fuel exceptional performance through an inclusive environment both now and in the future.
Summary:
In this role, you will facilitate and support the Machine Learning (ML) lifecycle using ML platforms by utilizing and building necessary infrastructure. You will support, onboard, and maintain models that are of strategic importance. You will partner with Data Scientists, cloud operations and stakeholder teams to implement production-grade models with necessary infrastructure, analytics and integrated workflow.
Responsibilities:
Assist to design, architect, and execute building ML models.
Participate in Agile team meetings to plan and estimate stories.
Create and test algorithm prototypes based on project specifications.
Troubleshoot and address problems with deployed models to improve user experience.
Encourage innovation while experimenting and adopting new technologies.
Work closely with operations, data science and other teams to improve architecture and scalability.
Remain up to date on the latest innovations in machine learning.
Qualifications:
Relevant degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Math or similar preferred.
5 or more years of relevant experience in ML development required.
Solid engineering foundation in ML or Artificial Intelligence (AI) required.
Strong knowledge of Python and R programming to develop software required.
Strong mathematics and statistics skills required.
Experience with technologies including ML, Natural Language Processing (NLP), data mining, distributed computing, and computer vision preferred.
In-depth knowledge of ML data structures and modeling, software architecture, libraries and frameworks to create AI preferred.
Creative thinking skills to devise new solutions and unique approaches.
Sound problem-solving skills to refine prototypes and troubleshoot performance issues.
You must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship.

Sitewise Analytics is a recognized, boutique, customer-centric company that has been on the North American commercial real estate scene providing predictive analytics software and solutions since 2012. Industry-leading corporations and franchisors partner with Sitewise Analytics to work out varied business questions from sales forecasting and sales impact assessment, to portfolio optimization and whitespace analysis. Clients include Burger King, Wingstop, Lululemon, The North Face, Aspen Dental, Banfield Pet Hospitals and many other organizations in the restaurant, retail and healthcare sectors.
This role will be based at Sitewise Analytics’ office in Plano, TX, along with other members of the Predictive Analytics Team. The Team uses a hybrid model of working from home and at the office. The company’s owners intentionally facilitate an extraordinary environment that engages employees to stretch, grow and deliver outstanding business support services to customers. At the heart of Sitewise Analytics is a nimble, diverse, motivated and passionate Predictive Analytics Team. The members of the team interact directly with decision-makers at several levels within client companies. Using a dynamic mix of machine learning approaches blended with classical statistical techniques and spatial analytics, the members of the team develop predictive models and provide strategic advice to decision-makers in customer organizations. As a result of successful growth, the Sitewise Analytics Team is delightfully expanding to include another Senior Predictive Modeler.
Using our proprietary modeling processes and Sitewise Pro technology platform, the Senior Predictive Modeler has a mandate to help customers solve complex business challenges. Fundamental to the role is the responsibility to be proactive and curious, to listen deeply to stated and unstated client needs and to develop and implement custom models to address those needs in thoughtful, impactful and explainable ways. The Senior Predictive Modeler will report to the Director of Analytics Operations and work closely with leaders and executives within customer organizations.
The ideal candidate for the role of Senior Predictive Modeler is a calm, creative model builder with superb listening, analytical, organizational, Excel, computer and problem-solving skills. The candidate must have a minimum of three years of relevant business experience, with a proven track record of building statistically sound and interpretable sales forecasting models. The candidate must possess the ability to successfully manage multiple projects, on time, and to work effectively with detail, without losing sight of the big picture. The candidate must a have genuine desire and proven capacity to work directly with clients and a deep commitment to ensuring that services are delivered consistently and in accordance with Sitewise’s internal best practice standards. The candidate must have completed a master-level degree in a relevant discipline such as data science or econometrics. Able to work independently and with minimal supervision, the candidate must be a results-oriented team player who can contribute positively in a fast-paced environment with competing priorities.
Preferred qualifications include experience in machine learning algorithms, including KNN, Random Forest, K-Means Clustering, as well as working knowledge of Alteryx, Python/R. It would be an asset to have experience or prior exposure to market research and retail analytics.

Data Scientist - Healthcare

Position Description
Join this multifaceted organization as a Data Scientist!

The best version of us starts with You!

CGI seeks a highly motivated Data Scientist to join our organization of data engineers and data scientists who collect, store, process, and analyze huge sets of data. Your main focus will be applying machine learning (ML) and data mining techniques, performing statistical analysis, and building high quality analytic systems - deep learning, anomaly detection, natural language processing (NLP), recommendation systems, predictive analytics and information retrieval. You'll mentor teammates, develop algorithms and scripts, apply machine learning, and use the right combination of tools and frameworks to turn that set of disparate data points into recommended and measurable insights.

This position is based in Lafayette, LA (Preferred) but can also be on-site in Bloomfield, CT

Your future duties and responsibilities
Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers/regressors using machine learning techniques.
Data mining using innovative methods - deep learning, learning to rank, anomaly detection.
Extending existing data with third party and open sources of information when needed.
Improving data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems.
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis.
Perform analysis and proactive assessments of issues along with giving appropriate solutions.
Draft, refine and present machine learning foresight to business partners.
Crafting automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
At least 7+ years of overall experience in machine learning and data mining techniques.
Experience in machine learning (ML) techniques and algorithms, such as Boosting, k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, natural language processing (NLP) etc.
Experience in deep learning techniques - neural networks, Boltzmann machines, auto-encoders, etc.
Experience in using various model optimization techniques including Hyperparameter tuning, etc.
Experience with at least one of common data science and software development toolkits, such as Python, Spark, Scikit Learn, MLFlow, Git, etc.
Experience with any one of the following data visualization tools, such as Tableau, Dash, Streamlit, Power BI, Qlik, D3, etc.
Experience with integration of data from multiple data sources (on-premises databases, Lakehouse, etc.).
Experience with SQL Server databases.
Experience with Spark-SQL, MySQL, T-SQL.
Shown applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.
Ability to interpret and communicate highly sophisticated model results and their business impact to senior leaders.
Exposure to Model Deployment and Maintenance techniques
Intermediate data migration skills for cross-platform databases (on-premises databases, Lakehouse, etc.).

Education: Master's degree preferred, or at least a bachelor's degree in computer science, Applied Mathematics/Statistics, Data Science, or Data Analytics.

Desired qualifications/non-essential skills:
Experience with cloud providers - Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure
Experience with Cloudera/MapR/Hortonworks/Databricks

job title: Hands-on Technical Product Manager: LLMs / Data Science / AI+NLP / Research
job description:
Megagon Labs is an innovation hub within the Recruit Group, conducting top-notch research and building technologies in Mountain View and Tokyo. We are making impacts through the Recruit Group’s worldwide services and products by collaborating with its subsidiaries such as Indeed and Glassdoor. Our mission is to empower people with better information to make their best decision. The areas we focus are Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Data Management, Data Integration, and Human-Computer Interaction.
As a Technical Product Manager, you will be productizing NLP research results, and play a key role in tech transfer to our subsidiaries for production deployment. Your role will require you to work closely with research and engineering teams and bridge the gap in transforming research into deliverables. This is not a typical product role; we have a finite set of potential internal customers within our family of companies, and are engaged in maturing cutting-edge NLP and AI research outputs for real-world use.
Responsibilities
Overall:
own 1 or 2 ongoing projects which take research and/or proof-of-concept results through to collaboration and eventual production deployment
help define roadmap for ongoing projects as they mature into collaborations with our partners
maintain relationships with our partner-stakeholders, stakeholder prospects, internal research and development teams
Any given week, you might find yourself engaged in:
vetting, acquiring, and sometimes cleaning new data sets for training/test/evaluation
going deep into Megagon research and proof-of-concept outputs and assessing those capabilities for mapping to real-world uses
needfinding with stakeholders, researchers, etc, as well as out “in the wild”
light hands-on prototyping of architectures and techniques, focused on basic validation of technical concepts - inclusive of data analysis, preparation, and sampling, model training and evaluation; creating low-fi mockups
maintaining high-level tracking of important measurements, such as active projects in our Leaderboard, KPIs and other metrics shared with our partner-stakeholders, etc.
Qualifications
BS / MS in a STEM field
demonstrable experience with data analysis and/or data science
your relevant work experience includes background in product delivery
overall relevant work experience - BS & 3+ years or MS & 1+ years
hands-on ML experience
bonus if you have background in NLP, graph algorithms, deep learning
proficient in coding using an open-source stack
