The Opportunity:
Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that there’s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing big data can yield pivotal insights when it’s gathered from disparate sources. We need a big data experienced professional like you to help our clients find answers in their data to impact important missions from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence.
As a lead big data engineer at Booz Allen, you’ll use your expertise to lead data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. You’ll oversee the development and deployment of pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful. Here, you’ll guide and mentor a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. You’ll use your expertise in analytical exploration and data examination while you oversee the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients. Work with us to use big data for good.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
8+ years of experience with data engineering, data architecture, machine learning engineering, or software engineering
8+ years of experience designing, developing, operationalizing, and maintaining complex data applications at enterprise scale
5+ years of experience with a large program management project or managing technical teams
Experience creating software for retrieving, parsing, and processing structured and unstructured data
Experience with Agile project management methodologies
Experience building scalable ETL/ELT workflows for reporting and analytics
Experience creating solutions within a collaborative, cross-functional team environment
Ability to develop scripts and programs for converting various types of data into usable formats and support project team to scale, monitor, and operate data platforms
Secret clereance
Bachelor’s degree
Nice If You Have:
Experience with client and industry relationships across the US Navy
Experience with Python, SQL, Scala, or Java
Experience with UNIX and Linux, including basic commands and Shell scripting
Experience with a public cloud, including AWS, Microsoft Azure, or Google Cloud
Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka
Experience working on real-time data and streaming applications

Create Your Career:
Grow With Us
Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.
A Place Where You Belong
Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll develop your community in no time.
Support Your Well-Being
Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.
Your Candidate Journey
At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. The projected compensation range for this position is $93,300.00 to $212,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

job title: Senior Vice President / Senior Data Architect/Manager - Rutherford NJ - Hybrid
job description:
Citi’s Global Functions Technology (GFT) is responsible for delivering Technology solutions to Citi's Global Functions organizations. GFT's mission is to optimize Citi's Technology environment by delivering world class applications, driving standardization of the production environment, reducing complexity, optimizing management of systems supporting global functions such as Compliance, Data, Risk and Finance, and introducing innovative technologies that provide new business capabilities, reduce the technology total cost of ownership, and create a competitive advantage for Citi
Global Risk and Controls Technology (GRCT) within Global Functions Technology supports global functions partners such as Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM), Retail Credit Risk, Operational Risk, Model Risk, Internal Audit, O&T Business Risk Control and Citi Chief Administrative Office. Enterprise Risk Management covers Risk Identification, Risk Measurement, Appetite and Limits, Risk Analytics, New Activity Risk Management, Risk Framework and Policy, Enterprise Risk Management Governance.
Job Purpose and Description: The Enterprise Risk Technology Data Engineering Manager, Senior Vice President will work on the build out the Enterprise Risk Data Layer (ERDL), to support the Enterprise Risk Management functions
Be a member of the senior leadership team as The Enterprise Risk Technology Senior Vice President, Data Engineering. This is a Senior Data Engineering Manager level position responsible for accomplishing results through the management of leading teams to establish and implement new or and revised data engineering systems and programs in coordination with the Business, Architecture, and Technology Teams as part of our large digital transformation journey. The overall objective of this role is to design and implement drive next generation, state of the art data analysis systems. You will manage the quality of the engineering teams’ quality of delivery, mentor the technical team, manage technical risk, and translate business needs into digital reality.
Responsibilities:
Manage multiple teams of professional performance evaluations, hiring and disciplinary actions
Lead teams from across the system to analyze data from internal and external systems
Provide expertise as a technical resource to solve complex business problems that translate into data integration and database systems designs
Ensure all deliverables are of high quality by adhering to standards and participating in code reviews
Mentor, support, and manage 100+ person teams
Bring data engineering principles, practices, and phlosophies into all data engineering projects
Create logical and physical data model architecture, data extract/transform/load processes, reporting and analytics solutions
Provide strategic influence and exercise control over resources, budget management and planning while monitoring end results
Influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, as well as communicate with external parties as necessary
Assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets
Drive compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency
Effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Qualifications:
15+ years’ experience in data engineering and end to end automation of data pipelines.
Experience in data modeling and information architecture including experience with Big Data, Relational Databases such as Oracle, columnar data stores, real-time data analytics, streaming and batch processing.
Experience with Java, data APIs, Data Lakes, open shift, reporting and analytics platforms
Comfortable with streaming and big data concepts using design patterns with software like Spark, Flink, Kafka, HDFS, Airflow, Elastic Search, and Ignite
Strong understanding of relational & NoSQL databases, data structures, data science and business intelligence workflows
Experience with large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS and other technologies.
Both technically deep and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within the organization
Experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning data toolkits
Experience managing global technology teams.
Working knowledge of industry practices and standards relative to data engineering
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication.
Financial Industry experience in risk management is a plus.
Education:
Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science or related field

job title: Machine Learning Engineer, Strong python programmer with AWS (SLC)
job description:
Principal AI/Machine Learning Engineer (Multiple levels – Tech Leads and Senior engineers)
Fidelity TalentSource is your destination for discovering your next temporary role at Fidelity Investments. We are currently sourcing for a ML Engineer to work in Salt Lake City, UT!
The Role
Are you interested in serving the needs of millions of customers by building the best-in-class digital experience that helps them in financial planning, investing, and retirement solutions? Our teams build and contribute to Fidelity’s digital presence. Our chapter comprises teams that work on a wide range of applications and platforms like Fidelity.com, Fidelity Mobile and Investor Centers. We're looking for product-aware engineers who are passionate, inquisitive, and responsible individuals to help us on our mission to deliver the best omni-channel experience to our customers.
The Expertise and Skills You Bring
Demonstrated hands on experience in the design and architecture of large-scale systems.
Proven experience in developing ML infrastructure in the Cloud (AWS preferred) for DataOps, MLOps and DevOps including creation of automated CI/CD pipelines for ML models and deploying ML solutions to production.
Solid experience with building data pipelines in getting the data required to build, train and evaluate ML models, using tools like Apache Spark, Snowflake or other distributed data processing frameworks and CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins or equivalent), version control (GitHub), Artifactory.
Proven experience in Object Oriented Programming, functional scripting languages like JavaScript (NodeJs), Unix scripting or related programming languages and exposure to some of Python’s ML ecosystem (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, sklearn, tensorflow, pytorch).
Solid knowledge of Cloud computing and infrastructure as code (IaS), hands-on experience with developing, deploying and managing applications in the Cloud.
You have working knowledge with Cloud Technologies such as Docker, Kubernetes, AWS CLI, AWS CloudFormation, and AWS services including EC2, EMR, EKS, S3 and Big Data ML toolkits, such as SparkML and Amazon SageMaker.
Knowledge of applied data science methods, feature engineering and machine learning algorithms, and usage of word embeddings in Natural Language Processing.
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a technology related field (e.g. Engineering, Computer Science, etc.).
The Team
We believe that diversity in background and experience will foster an inclusive and engaging work environment for our employees. This ultimately enables us to deliver a better product for our customers.
Being technically competent is only telling half the story. We believe that delivering the best possible customer experience requires an artful blend of human ingenuity and technology. While we value smart technologists, we are fanatics about our culture that promotes autonomy and leadership at all levels.
COVID Work Policy
Safety is our top priority. Once we can be together in person with fewer safety measures, this role will follow our dynamic working approach. You’ll be spending some of your time onsite depending on the nature and needs of your role.
Dynamic Working – Post Pandemic
Our aim is to combine the best of working offsite with coming together in person. For most teams this means a consistent balance of working from home and office that supports the needs of your role, experience level, and working style.
Your success and growth is important to us, so you’ll want to enjoy the benefits of coming together in person – face to face learning and training, quality time with your manager and teammates, building your career network, making friends, and taking full advantage of cultural and social experiences Fidelity provides for you.

Company Overview
Fidelity TalentSource is the in-house temporary staffing provider for Fidelity Investments, one of the largest and most diversified global financial services firms in the industry. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, including technology and customer service, to fill assignments across Fidelity’s U.S.-based regional and investor center locations. If you would like to experience Fidelity’s supportive and collaborative culture while expanding your skill set and developing your professional network, consider a role with Fidelity TalentSource. Apply today at FTSJobs.com.
We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.
Fidelity TalentSource will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, please contact our HR team at HR@ ftsjobs.com.
Information about Fidelity Investments
At Fidelity Investments, our customers are at the heart of everything we do. As a privately held company with a rich 75-year history, our mission has remained the same since our founding: to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com.
Fidelity Investments and Fidelity TalentSource are equal opportunity employers.

The Predictive Modeling Supervisor is responsible for updating line of business pricing models, support of ongoing initiatives, and identifying new opportunities for application of advanced predictive modeling techniques to drive significant business value. The Predictive Modeling Supervisor is responsible for the leadership and development towards the growth of team members within the analytics modeling team. They will provide technical leadership with expert level knowledge. The Predictive Modeling Supervisor will collaborate with key stakeholders and business leaders across the organization to solve complex business problems and create model-driven solutions for pricing, growth, and profitability.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Lead and develop a wide range of data-driven predictive models to create re-usable processes and methodologies for delivering results and pricing models
Works with team members to retrieve data from various internal and external sources in preparation for predictive modeling analysis
Verify accuracy of data pulled and revise methods of data retrieval by following a standard process, structuring, and data cleansing
Effectively communicate to business partners analytical design, insight forecasts, recommendations, and impact
Foster recommendations derived from predictive modeling results as well as enhancements to efficiency processes and workflows to impact profitability
Create effective business plans for modeling efforts as well as detailed project management of workloads, roles, and responsibilities
Support model monitoring and enhancements to ensure continued improvement of business results including periodic updates of models and production
Proactively develop solutions to mitigate business loss due to profitability issues and make appropriate recommendations for action and changes to reduce operational expense
Invest resources and time inside and outside the division to ensure success in predictive modeling findings and implementation with successful handoff of rules and procedures
Manage multiple large-scale modeling projects from beginning to end (design, development, and validation)
Lead and mentor, setting clear goals and expectations and providing regular feedback (positive and negative) to direct reports
Provide support and guidance to team members in terms of project workloads, issue resolution, best practices, individual growth and development, and job performance
Provide insight in the annual planning process, evaluating team priorities and capacity
Responsible for evaluation of team members and providing input on hiring, firing, and salary adjustment decisions
Maintain staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees
Document performance feedback and other personnel matters
Ensure adherence to company policies and procedures and undertake disciplinary actions if the need arises
Knowledge of leave policies and coordinating with HR
Work to maintain subject matter expertise not only on generalized linear models but also other current and emerging modeling techniques, and the ability to recognize and apply optional technique to each modeling initiative.
Build on predictive modeling and analysis skills as well as business understanding through internal and external coursework
Continuously focus on ways to improve leadership and supervisory skills
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree with an emphasis in Finance, Economics, Accounting or Statistics/Mathematics or related fields of expertise
5 years of insurance related experience or equivalent
3 years of predictive modeling experience
Qualifications & Skills:
Strong knowledge of business processes and analytical support systems, with detailed knowledge of both Emblem and Radar, or similar software
Strong computer skills including MS Office with demonstrated skills in Excel, with the ability to pull and manipulate data and information from internal and external sources
Experience with programming languages including SAS, SQL, R, or Python
Strong time management skills and ability to multi-task
Ability to effectively exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing
Advanced-level logical and analytical skills
Ability to learn new concepts, processes, and applications
Team player with the ability to establish and build effective relationships within and outside the organization
Strong leadership skills

Job Summary:

Job Responsibilties:
Utilizes statistical modeling to make predictions about future outcomes and in multiple scenarios. Evangelizes new ideas / technologies / solutions to gain acceptance from a wide range of audiences.
Interprets and applies data in the most complex analyses and explains findings to business audiences to improve products and processes.
Sets the vision for manipulation and analysis of large and complex data sets.
Leads the development and execution of statistical and mathematical analyses to support business decisions enterprise wide or for multiple business functions. Analyses have substantial impact on business operations or outcomes.
Documents projects including business objectives, data gathering and processing, leading approaches, final algorithm, detailed set of results and analytical metrics.
Leads the design and development of new and/or complex algorithms and statistical predictive models and determines analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate scenarios and potential future outcomes.
Implements activities that impact the critical directions of the organization. Typically assigned to the most critical and strategic / complex / high risk undertakings.
Determines leading edge technical / business approaches and/or develops major new technical tools.
Interacts with internal and external peers and management to develop unprecedented solutions that affect several areas.
Guides and mentors, a wide range of audiences. Provides guidance regarding analytical approach and iteration of algorithms.

About Walgreens and WBA

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.

Basic Qualifications
Master’s degree in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics OR a quantitative, computational or technical discipline AND at least 4 years of post graduate professional work experience in a statistical function
Deep knowledge of open source data science and statistics packages such as Python, R, Spark, etc.
Experience in data science, advanced analytics, or statistics.
Experience interrogating data, performing analyses, interpreting data, and presenting to business audiences.
Deep knowledge of SQL
Experience establishing and maintaining key relationships with internal (peers, business partners and leadership) and external (business community, clients and vendors) within a matrix organization to develop strategies that meet department goals within budget and timelines.
Experience presenting findings to all levels of an organization, including the C Suite level.
At least 2 years of experience contributing to financial decisions in the workplace.
At least 3 years of direct leadership, indirect leadership and/or cross functional team leadership.
Willing to travel up to/at least 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).

Preferred Qualifications
PhD in statistics, data science, mathematics, economics OR a quantitative, computational or technical discipline AND at least 2 years of post graduate professional work experience in a statistical function

Job Description
At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.
Boeing Defense Space & Security (BDS) has an exciting opportunity and immediate need on the P-8 Air Vehicle Program for a Lead Engineering Data Scientist in Tukwila, WA.

This role will be a part of the Air Vehicle Engineering team providing support to the E-7 and P-8 program. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to develop cutting edge tools for multiple programs across the division. This person will be responsible to lead cross-functional teams to determine, define and deploy sophisticated descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, or prescriptive analytic solutions integral to the development, evaluation and production for E-7 and P-8. The role will require the evaluation of stakeholder needs and choosing the best fit methods, defines algorithms, validates and deploys models, while performing the vital data preparation and improvements to models.

Position Key Responsibilities:
Create Maps for all digital data sources and data bases

Investigate and learn about information data sources capabilities and access

Build Indicators Dashboards with the support from engineering management

Identify sources of data to construct predictive and prescriptive models.

Construct predictive and prescriptive models for the engineering community within the P-8 program.

This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.

Basic Qualifications:
Advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor)

1+ years or more of knowledge and experience in data analysis algorithms (e.g. data mining, statistics, machine learning, natural language processing, text mining, visual analytics) and building Descriptive, Predictive and Prescriptive models

1+ years or more designing and creating new algorithms for the analysis of data to address project requirements, evaluate performance of data analysis algorithms and select and apply algorithms to meet application requirements

1+ years or more applying knowledge of 2D and/or 3D computer graphics to generate data representation and to communicate information

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in product production environment

Knowledge of multiple information technology areas

Systems thinking skills, the ability to understand the big picture and the inter-relationships of all positions and activities in the system, including the impact of changes in one area on another area

Experience communicating to program leadership

Typical Education & Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.

Relocation:
This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.

Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

Shift:
This position is for 1st shift

This is a union - represented position.

At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.

To meet export control compliance requirements, a “U.S. Person” as defined by 22 C.F.R. §120.15 is required. “U.S. Person” includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee.

AI Tech Lead

Position Description
CGI is seeking hands on development and technology lead to work with CGI's AI product development team. The candidate will focus on Data Science and Machine Learning techniques and be responsible for understanding product roadmap and features and underlying architecture. The AI Lead will provide oversight, guidance to the development team, liaison between product owners, and be a key collaborator.

Your future duties and responsibilities
Lead and manage development team of Data Scientists, Developers, Devops and Testers to adhere to product release timelines and budget.
Be the primary point of contact for critical issues, setting standard processes for code review. Responsible for execution of the technical plans set forth by the platform architect.
Detailed understanding of the products underlying core platform and services and be able to ramp up on the technology stacks rapidly.
Serve as an expert in translating complex data into key strategy insights and valuable actions.
Discover business narratives told by the data and present them to other scientists, business partners, and managers at different levels.
Develop and test heuristics.
Create and run statistic/ML models.
Perform data exploration and data mining.
Will be a key point of contact for application development and cloud deployment team and work closely with them for product deployment and migrations to the cloud (Azure ecosystem).

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Overall 7+ years' of proven experience as a Data Scientist .
3 - 5 years of data engineering, experience with modern software development technologies will be preferred.
Graduation from a four-year college or university with a degree in statistics, physics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, or management of information systems.
Expert hands on knowledge of SAS, Python Machine Learning or R
Solid understanding of statistics, programming and predictive modeling.
Knowledge of front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
Knowledge of back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)
Experience with API design and implementation
Big Data/Hadoop/NoSQL and experience with large datasets.

Job Summary:

Walgreens, one of the nation's largest drugstore chains, is included in the Retail Pharmacy USA Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc., the first global pharmacy-led, health and wellbeing enterprise. More than 10 million customers interact with Walgreens each day in communities across America, using the most convenient, multichannel access to consumer goods and services and trusted, cost-effective pharmacy, health and wellness services and advice. Walgreens operates 8,175 drugstores with a presence in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Walgreens Omni-channel business includes Walgreens.com. Approximately 400 Walgreens stores offer Healthcare Clinic or other provider retail clinic services.

As the neighborhood drugstore and retailer, our goal is to make health and happiness simpler, easier and within reach. And we remain a trusted wellness provider offering convenient access to important health services, such as immunizations and an array of pharmacy services that can help patients improve their health. To our team members, Walgreens represents a unique opportunity to excel in their careers in a welcoming and inclusive environment. We offer the chance to work in a truly supportive environment, and be a part of a progressive organization dedicated to the well-being of our customers, team members and the communities we all call home.

Job Responsibilities:
Develops and deploys scalable algorithms and models for solving various business problems and driving value for Walgreens Boots Alliance, drawing from knowledge and experience in machine learning/AI, constrained optimization, statistical theory, graph theory, or related fields. Application areas include, but are not limited to, prescription adherence improvement; patient health/outcome improvement; algorithmic process improvement/automation; labor scheduling and optimization; demand forecasting; supply chain optimization; capacity planning and network flow optimization; cost to serve optimization; pricing and promotions optimization; assortment and localization optimization; marketing intelligence; and personalization.
Collaborates with business clients, product managers, data engineers, front end developers, and other team members to build and deploy scalable ML/AI infused applications, or other data centric products that incorporate constrained optimization, statistical theory, large-scale forecasting, etc.
Develops and executes on ML/AI strategies and plans.
Works with key stakeholders to formulate a comprehensive plan that is consistent with the overall business objectives and budgetary considerations.
Applies broad knowledge of ML/AI capabilities to identify new growth areas, new and emerging opportunities. Conducts research by studying organization goals, strategies, practices, and user projects. Recommends strategies by evaluating organization outcomes; identifying problems; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements.
Shares highly complex information related to areas of expertise. Interacts with senior management to keep abreast of objectives. Interacts with peers to interpret information and improve cross-functional processes and programs. Builds and enhances key internal and external contacts.

An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

About Walgreens and WBA

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.

Basic Qualifications
PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Physics, Mathematics, Computational or Decision Sciences, or a related quantitative field.
Proficient level in at least one general purpose programming language, such as Python, C/C++, etc.
Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).

Preferred Qualifications
Advance knowledge of SQL
Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe/Caffe2, Gluon, Keras, or similar frameworks
Experience with cloud deployment of ML/AI applications
Knowledge of Azure HDInsight, Azure Databricks, Azure Kubernetes Service, etc.)

The Challenge:
For an organization to transform in today’s digital world, it needs to properly collect, store, and organize its data. Effective data management can enable more efficient operations, yielding more growth. As a data architect, you know how to apply your creative-thinking and analytical mindset to help organizations manage their data assets. We’re looking for an experienced data architect like you to deliver leading-edge solutions for an Air Command's Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) mission.
As a data architect, you’ll use your extensive technical expertise to design data architectures to support data science, data engineering, and data visualization. You’ll resolve routine data architecture issues in collaboration with technical teams by providing advice on data warehousing or data mesh methods and approaches, analyzing data architecture business needs, and working with project staff to make decisions and recommendations on future data architecture developments. You will apply a wide range of Big Data and Cloud technologies to propose recommendations for the development of data integration pipelines, scalable data storage environments, Application Programming interfaces (APIs), security procedures, and algorithms used to deliver data faster and more accurately to decision-makers. Along with your team, you will analyze the needs and the environment to ensure development considers the architecture and operating environment as well as future functionality and enhancements. Define and maintain canonical data elements and definitions, data models, policies and business rules, constraints using regular expressions, and reference datasets. You'll develop plans for implementing an enterprise data catalog to identify data quality and data lineage.
This team will deliver world class solutions to implement Artificial Intelligence, Automation and data Augmentation (AAA) and cloud strategy across the ISR enterprise by modernizing the digital environment to meet the requirements of Joint All Domain Command and Control (JADC2), Advance Battle Management System (ABMS), the Sensing Grid, Agile Combat Employment (ACE), the Intelligence Community’s (IC) Augmenting Intelligence with Machines (AIM), Information Environment, and Information Technology Environment strategies.
You’ll also provide mentoring and training for our mission partners, educating them about data architecture, data science, data engineering, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. Your advanced consulting skills and extensive technical expertise will guide clients as they navigate the landscape of data, algorithms, tools, and frameworks. With your drive to establish processes and lead technological innovation, you’ll make a lasting impact on the ISR mission.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
3+ years of experience with data architecture, data warehousing, and data governance
3+ years of experience leading business process reengineering, business process assessment, or business architectural development
3+ years of experience developing highly responsive data structures, metadata capture strategies, ontologies, and data dictionaries
3+ years of experience leading data operations teams to develop architecture or extract-transform-load (ETL) data pipelines
3+ years of experience managing an enterprise data catalog for a large organization
Experience with cloud technology supporting scalable data solutions
Knowledge of database development and administration, including process and software
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelor's degree
Nice If You Have:
3+ years of experience managing classified data as well as sensitive data
Experience working on multi-disciplinary Agile teams
Experience working with the Air Force
Knowledge of DoD enterprise data and systems
Knowledge of ISR capabilities, including sensing effects across multiple domains and how these effects can be leveraged in GEOINT, SIGINT, and MASINT sensed environments
TS/SCI clearance
Master's degree
Amazon Certified Solutions Architect or Associate Certification
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Build Your Career:
When you join Booz Allen, you’ll have the opportunity to connect with other professionals doing similar work across multiple markets. You’ll share best practices and work through challenges as you gain experience and mentoring to develop your career. In addition, you’ll have access to a wealth of training resources through our Analytics University, an online learning portal where you can access more than 5000 functional and technical courses, certifications, and books. Build your technical skills through hands-on training on the latest tools and state-of-the-art tech from our in-house experts. Pursuing certifications that directly impact your role? You may be able to take advantage of our tuition assistance, on-site boot camps, certification training, academic programs, vendor relationships, and a network of professionals who can give you helpful tips. We’ll help you develop the career you want as you chart your own course for success.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.
Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $81,800.00 to $186,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.
Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

NJM Insurance Group (NJM) seeks a Predictive Modeling Analyst to join the Predictive Analytics team at NJM.
About NJM
Founded in 1913, NJM is a regional property and casualty insurer with a national reputation for auto claims satisfaction. NJM offers Auto, Homeowners, Renters, Condo, and Umbrella insurance to individuals in Connecticut, Maryland, New Jersey, Ohio, and Pennsylvania.
NJM also offers Workers’ Compensation, Commercial Auto, Commercial Package and Businessowners insurance to businesses in Connecticut, Delaware, Maryland, New Jersey, New York, and Pennsylvania.
NJM's mission is to provide value-based insurance solutions for the benefit of our policyholders while maintaining the highest levels of service, integrity, and financial stewardship.
About Actuarial
The Actuarial department at NJM provides insight and analysis to help solve complex business problems. The department consists of the following teams: Personal Lines Pricing, Commercial Lines Pricing, Reserving, and Predictive Analytics.
The Role
As a Predictive Modeling Analyst, you will collaborate with colleagues across the company to solve important business problems. Model applications cover all areas of primary insurance operations in Personal and Commercial Lines insurance, including pricing, underwriting, claims, and marketing.
The analyst will be involved in all stages of model execution, including collaborating with business users, creating/testing/refining predictive models, quantifying business benefits, deploying models, and presenting results to technical and non-technical audiences.
This is a hybrid position with some on-site and telecommuting availability each week.
Qualifications
At least 2 years of predictive modeling experience or P&C actuarial experience.
A Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or related major.
Experience with SAS, SQL, and MS Office.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Role: Responsible for supporting the strategic data initiatives that drive business profitability, insight, increased efficiencies and improved customer experience. The ideal candidate is adept at using a variety of data assets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action. They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing solutions, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes. Responsibilities Lead the Information Technology research, design and implementation of data analysis and reporting solutions to support business strategies across all functional areas. Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive business solutions. Architect, implement, and monitor data pipelines, as well as conduct knowledge sharing sessions with peers to ensure effective data use. Extract data from multiple sources, using machine learning tools to organize data, process, clean, and validate the data. Enhancing data collection procedures to include all relevant information for developing analytic systems. Applies analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amounts of data, using advanced statistical techniques such as predictive statistical models, customer profiling, segmentation analysis, and data mining to support business strategies. Create data visualizations and presentations to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders to assist with strategic decision making. Assess the Information Technology effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques. Discover trends and patterns and present data using various data visualization techniques and tools. Work with Information Technology team members and business leaders to investigate technologies and tools for developing innovative solutions to increase automation, increased efficiency, and improved decision making. Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis and machine learning Perform other duties as assigned. Expectations: Collaborate with stakeholders and understand key business priorities and challenges to design the right actionable data and analytics solution to address needs. Communicate complex data in a simple, actionable way. Analyze and interpret large and complex data sets to assist stakeholders throughout the organization distill insights; connect disparate insights into cohesive, well-grounded recommendations. Assist stakeholders throughout the organization apply predictive modeling techniques to optimize the forecasts for planning needs. Assist stakeholders in presenting data findings and insights across most levels of leadership in a compelling way that facilitates discussion and lead to decisions. Program and write maintainable and well-documented scripts/applications for process automation; produce reusable models. Leverage programming skills to develop automated solutions that help improve business operations. Socialize the importance of data governance and ethics and ensure consistency around data quality through process improvements. Work closely with Information Technology Business Technology teams to maintain technologies, manage code within repositories, maintain appropriate documentation of solutions, perform testing to ensure accuracy of results, maintain governance processes, and continuously mature processes to align with industry best practices. Work closely with Internal Audit, Enterprise Risk Management, and cross functional business departments to ensure consistent application of practices across the company. Ability to work independently and with team members from different backgrounds to proactively evaluate data from wide variety of sources, make predictions, and identify potential business opportunities. Continuous commitment to education and awareness of industry best practice solutions for data analysis and automation. Protect business records created or used in business processes to ensure availability, confidentiality, integrity; and the retention and destruction as specified by relevant policies. Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously, ability to solve problems, memory for details, ability to prioritize, and ability to maintain concentrated mental and visual attention for sustained periods. Demonstrate a commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI). Provides reporting to the Office of Minority and Women Inclusion (OMWI), as needed, as well as partners with OMWI to implement effective policies and procedures that incorporate DEI into business activities. Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics, Statistics, or related field. Interpersonal Skills: The ability to motivate or influence others is a material part of the job, requiring a significant level of diplomacy and trust. Obtaining cooperation (internally and/or externally) is an important part of the job. Other Skills: Five to seven years of experience transforming and analyzing data from multiple sources to drive business insights Seven plus years of experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) Knowledge and experience with data science toolkits such as Matplotlib, Pandas, NumPy, and GitHub Two to five years of experience with visualization tools and data spreadsheets, including Cognos, Power BI and Excel Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques, algorithms, and their real-world advantages/drawbacks Advanced Theory and practical knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts and experience with applications. My Choice Wisconsin is proud to offer a rewarding work environment as an employer of choice. We are looking to add a Senior Data Analyst to our collaborative and growing team in Madison, Wisconsin!
Who We Are
Caring Starts Here where we embrace the whole person. We are Wisconsin’s largest Managed Care Organization (MCO) that serves seniors and adults with disabilities, making a difference in over 50 counties across the state.
Our Decision Support team collaborates across departments such as IT, Claims, Finance, and Quality to ensure our members are provided the best possible care and service. If you are looking for a career where you can utilize your analytic experience and share implementation ideas to improve the lives of others this may be the perfect opportunity for you!
What We Offer
A hybrid work modelwith in-office and work-from-home opportunities
Workday variety and opportunities for growth and advancement
Generous 401(k) program with 100% vesting AND company match on day 1
Competitive compensation
Paid time off, paid holidays, and a floating holiday
Medical, dental, and vision insurance programs
Employer-paid life and short-term disability insurance
What You'll Do as a Senior Data Analyst
Develops, produces, and maintains key performance metric dashboards for leadership and other relevant stakeholders throughout the organization.
Works closely with managers and teams to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, in order to deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Collaborates with various teams both within department and across the organization to determine report requirements and customer needs.
Creates and maintains rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources.
Produces routine, complex, and ad hoc reports as requested. Collaborates with various teams both within department and across the organization to determine reporting requirements and customer needs.
Analyzes data to answer key questions for stakeholders and investigate/communicate additional details for improvement.
Partners with IT Department to create reporting and ensure data integrity.
Completes analyses, reviews and improvement projects as needed in support of department to ensure goals and operating plans are achieved.
Supports staff with the use of reporting applications. Identifies root cause of issues impacting reporting and participates in developing plans to improve reporting functions as opportunities are identified.
Researches, analyzes, and understands business flows in order to facilitate reporting and support of users.
Facilitates the adoption of system-wide data integrity and standardization as identified by leadership. Participates in quality team meetings and ongoing related committee work, helping participants determine and implement best processes.
Documents and develops processes with other functional data owners to support ongoing maintenance.
Other duties as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications Required
Bachelor’s degree.
Four or more years of experience in claims, systems analytics or data analytics, or similar experience requiring analysis and reporting or business systems support.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with state and federal Medicaid and Medicare laws, regulations, and reporting requirements.
Experience with quality metrics such as HEDIS, pay-for-performance, and government regulated quality metrics.

job title: Senior Data Scientist - Accepting Recent PhD Graduates in Computer Science
job description:
Near-Miss Management (NMM) is seeking a talented and highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to further develop and scale its unique web-based data analytics platform. NMM provides powerful analytics software, based on machine learning and AI, to the chemical and energy industry – to improve reliability, and minimize failures and losses.
Within our engineering team, your voice will be a valuable asset to product development. You will be in a unique position to define/undertake technical needs of the software and help shape the future of its technology. You will enjoy an intellectually creative atmosphere as you work with an experienced and enthusiastic team that strives continuously to build and deliver a robust, reliable software system.
Responsibilities
One of the main responsibilities of this role is development of a new flagship product in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack. Further, you will be responsible for leading our efforts in improvement of existing data analytics and machine-learning models (implemented in Python using the Scipy/Numpy/Pandas stack). Aside from analytics, another important aspect of the role involves enhancement of the existing processing pipeline, which executes the analytics in a parallelized and distributed fashion – you will assist in refining that pipeline on an ongoing basis as new features and products are developed.
Required Qualifications
PhD in Computer Science or related fields
Strong Python experience with demonstrated Numpy and Pandas knowledge
Strong experience in data science and data engineering, particularly Machine Learning
Experience in developing analytics models from prototype stage to deployment with scale and performance in mind
Desired Qualifications
Ability to comfortably manage version control using Git
Experience with distributed systems design and architecture
Experience in Jupyter Notebook prototyping
General understanding of both NoSQL and relational databases and the ability to programmatically interface with them (Mongo, PostgreSQL, SQLAlchemy)
Experience with unit testing, integration testing, automated testing strategies, and continuous integration (e.g. travis, unittest, nosetest)
Experience with interfacing with RESTful APIs
Benefits
Competitive base salary with an excellent compensation program
Healthcare contribution, 401k contribution
Flexible office environment in a central location (Center City, Philadelphia)

Job Summary:

Walgreens, one of the nation's largest drugstore chains, is included in the Retail Pharmacy USA Division of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc., the first global pharmacy-led, health and wellbeing enterprise. More than 10 million customers interact with Walgreens each day in communities across America, using the most convenient, multichannel access to consumer goods and services and trusted, cost-effective pharmacy, health and wellness services and advice. Walgreens operates 8,175 drugstores with a presence in all 50 states, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands. Walgreens Omni-channel business includes Walgreens.com. Approximately 400 Walgreens stores offer Healthcare Clinic or other provider retail clinic services.

As the neighborhood drugstore and retailer, our goal is to make health and happiness simpler, easier and within reach. And we remain a trusted wellness provider offering convenient access to important health services, such as immunizations and an array of pharmacy services that can help patients improve their health. To our team members, Walgreens represents a unique opportunity to excel in their careers in a welcoming and inclusive environment. We offer the chance to work in a truly supportive environment, and be a part of a progressive organization dedicated to the well-being of our customers, team members and the communities we all call home.

Job Responsibilities:
Develops and deploys scalable algorithms and models for solving various business problems and driving value for Walgreens Boots Alliance, drawing from knowledge and experience in machine learning/AI, constrained optimization, statistical theory, graph theory, or related fields. Application areas include, but are not limited to, prescription adherence improvement; patient health/outcome improvement; algorithmic process improvement/automation; labor scheduling and optimization; demand forecasting; supply chain optimization; capacity planning and network flow optimization; cost to serve optimization; pricing and promotions optimization; assortment and localization optimization; marketing intelligence; and personalization.
Collaborates with business clients, product managers, data engineers, front end developers, and other team members to build and deploy scalable ML/AI infused applications, or other data centric products that incorporate constrained optimization, statistical theory, large-scale forecasting, etc.
Develops and executes on ML/AI strategies and plans.
Works with key stakeholders to formulate a comprehensive plan that is consistent with the overall business objectives and budgetary considerations.
Applies broad knowledge of ML/AI capabilities to identify new growth areas, new and emerging opportunities. Conducts research by studying organization goals, strategies, practices, and user projects. Recommends strategies by evaluating organization outcomes; identifying problems; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements.
Shares highly complex information related to areas of expertise. Interacts with senior management to keep abreast of objectives. Interacts with peers to interpret information and improve cross-functional processes and programs. Builds and enhances key internal and external contacts.

An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans

About Walgreens and WBA

Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170-year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high-quality products and services in communities nationwide.

Basic Qualifications
PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Physics, Mathematics, Computational or Decision Sciences, or a related quantitative field.
Proficient level in at least one general purpose programming language, such as Python, C/C++, etc.
Willing to travel up to 10% of the time for business purposes (within state and out of state).

Preferred Qualifications
Advance knowledge of SQL
Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe/Caffe2, Gluon, Keras, or similar frameworks
Experience with cloud deployment of ML/AI applications
Knowledge of Azure HDInsight, Azure Databricks, Azure Kubernetes Service, etc.)

job description:
About Blue Cross
Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Minnesota is one of the most recognized and trusted health care brands in the world with 2.5 million members. We’re committed to reinventing health care to improve health for our members and the community. We hope you'll join us.
How is this Role Important to Our Work?
This position works across the Enterprise to identify areas of opportunities to build process efficiencies, innovate and contribute using advanced analytics and data science. The position will manage sophisticated data and information to provide meaningful results, which influence strategic decision-making at Blue Cross. Responsibilities include understanding sophisticated business requirements, data management and stewardship for a variety of sophisticated data sources, data analysis and the application of sophisticated analytical techniques, and building predictive models to create value for the organization.
A Day in the Life:
Take lead on data science projects to craft and implement models and experiments from end to end, including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation.
Lead-by-example junior data scientists around mature data science practices e.g., readable code, detailed documentation, comprehensive experimentation.
Work with business partners to convert ambiguous business problems in clear data science/ML specifications. Use contextual business acumen to convert model predictions/results into impactful insights and provide actionable guidance on risks and limitations.
Drive conversations with product managers, data engineers, and subject matter experts to ship new models, algorithms and improvements continuously and collaboratively into production.
Use combination of machine learning knowledge and contextual business acumen to convert results into impactful insights and provide actionable guidance on risks and limitations of model.
Write narrative documents for model specification and performance analysis to communicate findings and recommendations to teammates, stakeholders and executive leadership.
Nice to Have:
Bachelor's degree.
Experience with health care data
Experience with AWS tools
Experience with version control (for example Git Version Control system)
Required Skills & Experience:
5+ years of related professional experience. All proven experience including work, education, transferable skills, and military experience will be considered.
Hands-on experience in analytics and data science (specific areas of interest include classification/regression, unsupervised learning, time-series/sequence models, NLP, explain-ability methods, deep learning).
2+ years of expereince implementing data science tools such as Python, R, Spark, SQL.
Experience implementing predictive algorithms and associated statistical analysis/inference in a data science/ML workflow manipulating both structured and unstructured data.
Experience crafting and presenting highly technical results to a diverse audience.
Comfortable working as part of a team and taking the lead.
Role Designation:
Teleworker
Role designation definition: Teleworking is working full time remote. Hybrid is a combination of working onsite and remotely. Onsite is full-time onsite.
Make a difference
Blue Cross is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer that values diversity. job title: AI and ML Research and Development Technologist, Senior
job description:
The Opportunity:
As an experienced engineer, you know that machine learning (ML) is critical to understanding and processing massive datasets. Your ability to conduct statistical analyses on business processes using ML techniques makes you an integral part of delivering a customer-focused solution. We need your technical knowledge and desire to problem-solve to support clients.
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced artificial intelligence (AI) and ML research and development (R&D) Lead Technologist with a background in integrating AI and ML into the framework of Intelligent Autonomous Systems (IAS). The ideal candidate will help build and lead an R&D team in developing and integrating cutting-edge AI and ML technologies into autonomous systems. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the design and development of advanced algorithms and software solutions that enable the effective operation of trusted autonomous systems. You will conduct experiments to explore new AI and ML technologies and collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, system engineers, and product managers to ensure the successful integration of these technologies into the IAS development pipeline. You will also help develop Test, Evaluation, Verification, and Validation (TEV&V) procedures and techniques for IAS.
Work with us to solve real-world challenges and define ML strategy for our key DoD clients.
Join us. The world can’t wait.
You Have:
Experience in AI or ML research and development, with a focus on autonomous systems
Experience with ML, computer vision, and deep learning algorithms
Experience with programming languages, including Python, C++, or Java
Ability to develop innovative ML models and algorithms and solutions to improve the performance of IAS
Ability to present research findings and recommendations to clients and executive leadership
Ability to build collaboration partnerships with industry and academic institutions
Ability to identify opportunities for innovation by keeping up with the latest developments in AI and ML technologies and autonomous systems technologies
Ability to obtain a security clearance
Bachelor's degree in CS or EE
Nice If You Have:
Experience with DevOps tooling, pipelines, and building containerized applications to run in a Kubernetes environment
Experience with CI/CD principles, methodologies, and tools, including GitLab CI/CD and Jenkins
Experience with distributed data and computing tools, including Spark, Databricks, Hadoop, Hive, AWS EMR, or Kafka
Experience leading a team of AI and ML engineers, researchers, and data scientists to develop and deploy advanced AI and ML technologies in autonomous systems
Possession of strong communication and leadership skills
Possession of strong R&D proposal writing and organization skills
Secret clearance
Master's degree in CS or EE
Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

Create Your Career:
Grow With Us
Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.
A Place Where You Belong
Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.
Support Your Well-Being
Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.
Your Candidate Journey
At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.
Compensation
At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Job Brief
$2,500 sign-on bonus and relocation expenses are negotiable.
The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is looking for a Sr. Data Architect to support our government customer located in Albuquerque, NM.
The role of the Sr Data Architect is to collaborate with data scientists, researchers, users, model and sim engineers, user experience designers, software engineers, digitizers, cataloguers, and system administrators to design a system to collect, manage, and convert raw data from the DTRIAC archive into usable information for U.S. deterrent missions.
The Sr. Data Architect will answer:
What variables should be stored?
What data quality issues might arise?
What database options are best for near term and long term?
What is the design of the data management system?
What system design will meet customer requirements?
Alaka'ina maintains a repository of over 20,000 films, 2,000,000 photographs, and 60,000,000 pages of documents dating back to The Manhattan Project. Alaka'ina will make repository digitally accessible to DTRA deterrent mission researchers in a way that provides knowledge and meaning using Machine Learning (ML), Artificial Intelligence (AI), and data science to return relevant search results to user queries
DESCRIPTION OF RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design tools and methodologies to process the digital collection in a production mode.
Develop and implement methods for, and configurations of, the Data Lake to support navigation, search, insertion, or extraction of information or files by the government or other performers without requiring proprietary software, tools, or data other than widely available commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) tools, and software that can be authorized for use on government IT systems.
Develop, maintain, and improve capabilities, such as scripting, to efficiently perform maintenance, synchronization, and production processing of data in the Data Lake on Windows- and Linux-based IT systems, including HPCMP clusters.
Implement, configure, perform functional testing, and operate the data and applications of the Advanced Search and Discovery (ASD) environment as a hosted capability on government IT systems.
Leverage the collection, capabilities, and team to perform targeted analyses and studies and to provide dedicated support to missions and end users.
Create documentation or training materials for Project Products.
Support integration or hosting of capabilities or products on government IT systems.
Hold and participate in Gate Reviews.
Other duties as assigned.
REQUIRED DEGREE/EDUCATION/CERTIFICATION:
Current Security+ Certification or equivalent required.
REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
5+ years relevant experience.
Experience with DevSecOps
Experience building and working with data pipelines and large data sets.
Experience with schema design and data modeling.
Deep understanding of algorithms and efficient data structures.
DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Experience using revision control software such as git
Experience using CI/CD tools such as GitHub
Experience with containerization using Docker, Podman, Apptainer/Singularity
Experience with databases, especially NoSQL and ElasticSearch
Experience with ML/DL particularly NLP
Experience with OCR
Experience with computer vision/image processing
Proficiency in Python
REQUIRED CITIZENSHIP AND CLEARANCE:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Active Secret or DOE Q Clearance required.

The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is a fast-growing government service provider. Employees enjoy competitive salaries; a 401K plan with company match; medical, dental, disability, and life insurance coverage; tuition reimbursement; paid time off; and 11 paid holidays.
We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We are proud to state that we do not discriminate in employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you are a person with a disability and you need an accommodation during the application process, please click here to request accommodation. We E-Verify all employees.
The Alaka`ina Foundation Family of Companies (FOCs) is comprised of industry-recognized government service firms designated as Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO)-owned and 8(a) certified businesses. The Family of Companies (FOCs) includes Ke`aki Technologies, Laulima Government Solutions, Kūpono Government Services, and Kapili Services, Po`okela Solutions, Kīkaha Solutions, LLC, and Pololei Solutions, LLC. Alaka`ina Foundation activities principally benefit the youth of Hawaii through charitable efforts which includes providing innovative educational programs that combine leadership, science & technology, and environmental stewardship.
For additional information, please visit www.alakainafoundation.com.

job title: Vice President Data Architect Lead Analyst - Rutherford NJ - Hybrid
job description:
Citi’s Global Functions Technology (GFT) is responsible for delivering Technology solutions to Citi's Global Functions organizations. GFT's mission is to optimize Citi's Technology environment by delivering world class applications, driving standardization of the production environment, reducing complexity, optimizing management of systems supporting global functions such as Compliance, Data, Risk and Finance, and introducing innovative technologies that provide new business capabilities, reduce the technology total cost of ownership, and create a competitive advantage for Citi
Global Risk and Controls Technology (GRCT) within Global Functions Technology supports global functions partners such as Enterprise Risk Management (ERM), Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM), Retail Credit Risk, Operational Risk, Model Risk, Internal Audit, O&T Business Risk Control and Citi Chief Administrative Office. Enterprise Risk Management covers Risk Identification, Risk Measurement, Appetite and Limits, Risk Analytics, New Activity Risk Management, Risk Framework and Policy, Enterprise Risk Management Governance.
Job Purpose and Description: The Enterprise Risk Technology Data Architect Lead Analyst, Vice President will work on the build out the Enterprise Risk Data Layer (ERDL), to support the Enterprise Risk Management functions
Be a member of the leadership team as the Enterprise Risk Technology Vice President, Data Engineering. This is a Senior Data Engineer level position responsible for leading teams to establish and implement new and revised data engineering systems and programs in coordination with the Business, Architecture, and Technology Teams as part of our large digital transformation journey. The overall objective of this role is to design and implement next generation, state of the art data analysis systems. You will manage the quality of the engineering teams’ quality of delivery, mentor the technical team, manage technical risk, and translate business needs into digital reality.
Responsibilities:
Lead teams from across the system to analyze data from internal and external systems
Provide expertise as a technical resource to solve complex business problems that translate into data integration and database systems designs
Ensure all deliverables are of high quality by adhering to standards and participating in code reviews
Mentor, support, and manage 100+ person teams
Bring data engineering principles, practices, and philosophines into all data engineering projects
Create logical and physical data model architecture, data extract/transform/load processes, reporting and analytics solutions
Provide strategic influence and exercise control over resources, budget management and planning while monitoring end results
Influence and negotiate with senior leaders across functions, as well as communicate with external parties as necessary
Effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Qualifications:
7+ years experience in data engineering and end to end automation of data pipelines
Experience in data modeling and information architecture including experience with Big Data, Relational Databases such as Oracle, columnar data stores, streaming and batch processing
Strong experience with Java, data APIs, Data Lakes, reporting and analytics platforms
Strong experience with streaming and big data concepts using design patterns with software like Spark, Flink, Kafka, HDFS, AirFlow, Elastic Search, and Ignite
Strong understanding of relational & NoSQL databases, data structures, data science and business intelligence workflows
Experience with openshift container platform is desired
Experience with Data Management projects such as Data Governance, Data Lineage, Data Entrichment, Data Entitlement, Data Security, Data Quality, Master Data Management, Reference Data Management, Metadata Management
Experience with artificial intelligence and machine learning data toolkits
Experience managing global data engineering teams
Working knowledge of industry practices and standards relative to data engineering
Financial Industry experience in risk management is a plus
Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field
